titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Alexander Harrison Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff and Issayas Tesfamariam

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-04-11T16:05-0700

did.abstract: Sound recordings and written summaries of interviews, other writings, and photographs relating to the role of the Organisation Armée Secrète (OAS) in the Algerian war for independence and the attempted coup against President Charles de Gaulle of France. Includes interviews with Raoul Salan, Edmond Jouhaud, Maurice Challe, and other leaders of the Organisation Armée Secrète, and the typescript of Harrison's book, Challenging de Gaulle: The O.A.S. and the Counterrevolution in Algeria, 1954-1962.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. Use copies of some sound recordings, video recordings, or motion picture material in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alexander Harrison papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sound recordings and written summaries of interviews, other writings, and photographs relating to the role of the Organisation Armée Secrète (OAS) in the Algerian war for independence and the attempted coup against President Charles de Gaulle of France. Includes interviews with Raoul Salan, Edmond Jouhaud, Maurice Challe, and other leaders of the Organisation Armée Secrète, and the typescript of Harrison's book, Challenging de Gaulle: The O.A.S. and the Counterrevolution in Algeria, 1954-1962.

did.unittitle: Book manuscript, "Challenging de Gaulle: The O.A.S. and the Counterrevolution in Algeria 1954-1962,"
Gras, Jean-Paul, Claude Dupont, and Joseph Cabero-Borgia,
Interview with various former OAS members,
49 color photographs of former leaders of the OAS and of sites in Algeria associated with OAS activities,
59 color photographs of former leaders of the OAS,
20 photographs of former leaders of the OAS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interviews conducted in France of leaders of the Organisation Armée Secrète. On compact sound cassettes. Tapes have been arranged according to the numbers given on their labels.
